content.full_text: Anthony L. Knapp and Charles H. Knapp to Abraham Lincoln, 5 June 18491 We have taken the liberty of signing the Doctor's name to the communicationenclosed,
paragraphs: Anthony L. Knapp and Charles H. Knapp to Abraham Lincoln, 5 June 18491
We have taken the liberty of signing the Doctor's name to the communicationenclosed,

footnotes.text:
1Anthony L. Knapp wrote this letter and signed his name.  Charles H. Knapp signed his
                  name.
2Abraham Lincolnâ€™s letter to Augustus R. Knapp has not been located.

3The letter or petition referenced was not enclosed with this letter and has not been
                  located.

4Reference to the contest to see who would replaceRichard M. Youngas commissioner of theU.S. General Land Office.Justin H. Butterfield,James L. D. Morrison, andCyrus Edwardswere among the early contestants. Lincoln entered the competition after learning
                  that Butterfield was favored over Morrison and Edwards.  Ultimately, neither Morrison,
                  Edwards, nor Lincoln received the appointment; the job went to Butterfield instead.
                  See theGeneral Land Office Affair.
